name: Self-Care
description: From meditation to team-building, Starfleet has increased its recent wellness push in the face of the ongoing temporal anomaly crisis. But Fullerton and his followers have stepped up their attacks in equal measure. Address these threats.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Bajoran, Federation, and Ferengi Alliance Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Pascal Fullerton, any version of Chakotay, Barrows, Una, or Casual crew will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Pascal Fullerton, Chakotay, Barrows, Una, or Casual
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Leeta
featured_crew.flavor: While vacationing on Risa, Leeta and Bashir amicably end their relationship with the ancient Bajoran Rite of Separation.

action.name: Our Paths Have Grown Apart

featured_crew.name: Barrows
featured_crew.flavor: Yeoman Barrows was one of the members of a group that became trapped on the shore leave planet.

action.name: It Is Beautiful. So Lovely, And Restful
I Am The Very Model Of A Modern Major General

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Punk
rewards.flavor: A man simply enjoying music on the bus before Spock puts an end to his unkind outbursts.

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: While vacationing on Risa, Leeta and Bashir amicably end their relationship with the ancient Bajoran Rite of Separation.

adventures.name: Prime Directive
adventures.description: Get Fullerton edited versions of Starfleet files he wants.

adventures.name: In Infinite Combination
adventures.description: Offer up high-ranking official to swap places with hostages.

adventures.name: Obsolescence
adventures.description: Get Fullerton requested technology, without some features.

adventures.name: Want Vs Need
adventures.description: Give Fullerton what he wants and free the hostages.

rewards.name: Self-Care
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Prime Directive
adventures.description: Get Fullerton edited versions of Starfleet files he wants.

adventures.name: Through Hardship
adventures.description: Give Fullerton a training holoprogram he requested.

adventures.name: In Infinite Combination
adventures.description: Offer up high-ranking official to swap places with hostages.

adventures.name: Want Vs Need
adventures.description: Give Fullerton what he wants and free the hostages.

rewards.name: Self-Care
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

action.name: I Am The Very Model Of A Modern Major General

rewards.name: Barrows
rewards.flavor: Yeoman Barrows was one of the members of a group that became trapped on the shore leave planet.

action.name: It Is Beautiful. So Lovely, And Restful

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "It would be much easier to enjoy leave if the looming threat of Pascal Fullerton weren't hanging over us. He's like a rain cloud threatening to ruin a sunny day."
"Rain cloud isn't a bad way to describe him. He sure is a stick in the mud. I can't even say I understand what his problem with the Federation is."
"He insists the Federation and Starfleet have gone soft. This recent wellness push by Starfleet certainly isn't helping convince him we haven't all turned hedonistic and self-centered."
"But the temporal anomaly crisis has presented some of the most intense challenges of my career. I'd love to be able to enjoy my leave without worry. Think you can help us all out, Captain?"
"It would be much easier to enjoy leave if the looming threat of Pascal Fullerton weren't hanging over us. He's like a rain cloud threatening to ruin a sunny day."
"Rain cloud isn't a bad way to describe him. He sure is a stick in the mud. I can't even say I understand what his problem with the Federation is."
"He insists the Federation and Starfleet have gone soft. This recent wellness push by Starfleet certainly isn't helping convince him we haven't all turned hedonistic and self-centered."
"But the temporal anomaly crisis has presented some of the most intense challenges of my career. I'd love to be able to enjoy my leave without worry. Think you can help us all out, Captain?"
"Thank you, Captain, for your assistance. It seems like you helped resolve several issues at once. And it looks like Pascal Fullerton has actually backed off."

"Don't speak too soon. This message just came in from Pascal himself. Coordinates indicate he's on a world at the edge of Federation space that Starfleet was using for leave and team-building. Listen."

responses.text: "Is it just me or is he insistent on being miserable?"

screens.text: "It seems you have no interest in getting the message. I'm afraid I'll need to take more drastic measures. But if it opens your eyes, it's worth it. My demands are attached. You will meet them if you want to see these people again."

"Apparently. There were a few crews doing team-building exercises on that planet during their leave. No one can get in touch with the individual captains. He must have taken all communication devices."

"His list of 'demands' isn't exactly coherent. Some of it is supplies. Then there are some esoteric items like 'We demand the Federation begin adhering to the Prime Directive it espouses'. How exactly do we prove we 'meet' that demand?"
"I agree. If he hadn't taken hostages, I would say we should just ignore him. But he has. And at this point, even if we rescue them, I'm not convinced he won't escalate."
"Well, Captain, looks like we'll have to lean on you again. You might need to get creative with this one. There's no telling what's going on down there."
"Thank you, Captain, for your assistance. It seems like you helped resolve several issues at once. And it looks like Pascal Fullerton has actually backed off."

"Don't speak too soon. This message just came in from Pascal himself. Coordinates indicate he's on a world at the edge of Federation space that Starfleet was using for leave and team-building. Listen."

responses.text: "Is it just me or is he insistent on being miserable?"
